A **poisonous cloak** is a type of [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") and has a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Randomized appearance (SLASH'EM)").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
  - [2.1 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

A cursed -1 poisonous cloak appears within the Chamber of Junk in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest"). In SlashTHEM, this also applies to the [Undertaker quest](/index.php?title=Undertaker_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Undertaker quest (page does not exist)"), whose goal level is a copy of the Lawful Quest.

In Hack'EM, poisonous cloaks usually generate cursed.

## Description

While worn, the cloak confers no base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") before enchantment and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")3. Upon wearing a poisonous cloak, you are subjected to a single [poisoned](/wiki/Poisoned "Poisoned") "attack" that deals standard HP damage and reduces [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), including a 1⁄3 chance of killing you instantly;[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) the cloak is then [auto-identified](/wiki/Auto-identified "Auto-identified"). If you have [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), a message is printed upon wearing the cloak with no other effect.[\[2\]](#cite_note-itch-2)

### Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, the chance of instadeath only applies if the player has less than 25% poison resistance; the player will still take poison damage subject to reduction by how much resistance they currently have. Poisonous cloaks also prevent HP regeneration while worn, regardless of poison resistance.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a poisonous cloak will produce an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), and vice versa.

## Strategy

The poisonous cloak's primary purpose is to make wearing random cloaks a very [bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea"): identifying them informally before you have poison resistance is difficult, since they have the same odds of generating cursed as most items, compared to other armor such as [gauntlets of fumbling](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_fumbling "Gauntlets of fumbling") and [levitation boots](/wiki/Levitation_boots "Levitation boots") that is generally undesirable to wear cursed. This is likely because the poison effect only occurs once each time you wear it: if you survive putting on a poisonous cloak, it is harmless to leave on until you find another suitable cloak, and even provides a source of MC3 if all else fails.

In Hack'EM, the cloak can additionally be upgraded into an alchemy smock, which provides valuable poison *and* [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") simultaneously.

### Identification

- *Main article: [Price identification#SLASH'EM](/wiki/Price_identification#SLASH.27EM "Price identification")*

Price identification can be deceptively difficult for this cloak. The poisonous cloak is the only one with a base price of 40[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm"), but does not generate as mostly cursed (outside of Hack'EM) meaning it may have some form of enchantment: a +1 enchantment gives them the same cost as a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection") or a [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement"). The only methods to identify a poisonous cloak that are absolutely certain are to formally identify all randomized cloaks you intend to put on.

## History

The poisonous cloak first appears in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6") as the **cloak of poisonousness**.

## Messages

- This cloak feels a little itchy.

  You wore a poisonous cloak while you had poison resistance.[\[2\]](#cite_note-itch-2)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [do\_wear.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 233](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do_wear.c#line233 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do wear.c")
2. ↑ [2.0](#cite_ref-itch_2-0) [2.1](#cite_ref-itch_2-1) [do\_wear.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 228](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do_wear.c#line228 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do wear.c")
